intro: Tricalysia ovalifolia var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-leafed tricalysia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glabrous leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
